str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A commander of a thousand men, a military tribune. From chilioi and archo; the commander of a thousand soldiers

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Roman; subst: a Roman citizen. From Rhome; Romaean, i.e. Roman.
Yes, certainly, even so. A primary particle of strong affirmation; yes.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
